p.s: As stated in the summary presidentPresident Barack Obama gave a speech dealing with the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchangexchange.
Following to this I'm going to analyse it'sits structure and choice of words.
In order to encourage his listeners to taking part in intercultural exchanges Obama divides his speech chronologically in four paragraphs.
In three of these sections can be founded a climax.
While he first talks about AmericasAmerica's view to the topic (ll. 4-11) he secondly speaks about the world's view (ll. 13-17) and lastly about individuals (ll. 18-22).
Concerning the choice of words Obama uses an everyday register which helps to connect with the young audience (cf. ll. 21-22).
Many ideagraphs are also used during his speech with words like idealism e.g. (l. 6).
Regarding the effect this creates a sense of identity.
Moreover, one can find multiple stylistic devices as a metaphor in line 13.
Break down walls helps to visualise the meaning of losing our differences in this case.
Parallelism is aan often used stylistic devices by Obama as in lines 18-20 which helps to emphasise the idea of chosingchoosing and building your own future.
Nevertheless, Obama is using a direct adressaddress as us in line 13 which is including us and creates a relationship to the audience.

Summing up one can say that Obama gave a convingconvincing speech about intercultural exchanges by using a clear and effective structure such as including a variety of stylistic devices and an optimal choice of words.
